meanings.definition: To relieve of a burden or load.
meanings.sent1: She felt lighter after disburdening herself of the heavy backpack.
meanings.sent2: The workers were disburdening the truck of its cargo.
meanings.sent3: After disburdening the suitcase, she realized it was full of rocks instead of clothes.
meanings.sent4: Disburdening his mind of worries was like lifting a weight off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The act of disburdening brought a sense of freedom and ease.

meanings.definition: To free from a burden or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was disburdening the students of their homework for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: He was disburdening himself of the guilt that had weighed on him for years.
meanings.sent3: Disburdening him of the task was like granting him a day off in the middle of the week.
meanings.sent4: She saw disburdening her friend of the secret as a way to strengthen their bond.
meanings.sent5: The act of disburdening allowed him to focus on what truly mattered in life.
